body.p: Match the following statement or picture with the correct class of lever that it describes or illustrates.
The load is located between the applied force and the fulcrum.

response.feedback: Incorrect. First class levers the load is located at one end and the fulcrum is in the middle.
Correct. Second class levers have the load between the applied force and fulcrum.
Incorrect. In third class levers the force is applied between the load and the fulcrum.

question.body: Speed and distance traveled are increased at the expense of force

response.feedback: Incorrect. In first class levers, the load is located at one end and the fulcrum is in the middle.
Incorrect. Second class levers have the load between the applied force and fulcrum. This allows for more force.
Correct. In third class lever, the force is applied between the load and the fulcrum which allows for greater speed and distance.
